data.text:
About Us

The Gregory Pascale Foundation is a non- profit organization, dedicated to raising awareness and education on the dangers of fentanyl poisoning, as well as increasing resources and advocacy to prevent the fentanyl crisis.

We are on this mission on honor of Gregory Pascale, who tragically lost his life to fentanyl poisoning in 2022.

Our goals:

Education and awareness on fentanyl poisoning

By providing accessible education, we empower individuals and communities to recognize and respond effectively to fentanyl-related health emergencies.

Advocate to prevent the distribution of illicit fentanyl

We collaborate with policymakers, law enforcement, and communities to implement effective strategies that disrupt illegal fentanyl supply chains.

Promote harm reduction

We support evidence-based interventions and provide resources to ensure safer practices among those at risk, helping to reduce the incidence and severity of fentanyl poisoning.

Legislation

Addressing lawmakers on the local , state, and national levels to urge them to use every tool available to eliminate fentanyl poisonings and overdose. Also following legislation introduced to the fentanyl crisis and supporting lawmakers who introduce meaningful legislation to stop the flow of fentanyl at the state and national level.
